thread.title: Pittenger’s 4 TDs lead Maryville - News Sentinel
thread.title_full: Pittenger’s 4 TDs lead Maryville - News Sentinel Story

author: News Sentinel staff
title: Pittenger’s 4 TDs lead Maryville - News Sentinel
text:
Evan Pittenger matched a scoring record for Maryville College Saturday afternoon and the Scots needed every one of the senior quarterback's four touchdowns.
The TDs were vital to a tough 31-26 road victory over Averett University in Danville, Virginia.
Pittenger, who rushed for 104 yards on 19 carries, reached the end zone on runs of 25, 5 and a pair of 1-yard runs for Maryville (6-1, 3-1 USA South).
The four scores equaled Charsie Robertson's single-game feat. He scored four touchdowns against Kentucky Wesleyan in 1994.
Pittenger, who also threw for 142 yards, scored three times before halftime as Maryville built a 24-6 lead.
Averett (1-5, 1-2) rallied in the second half. The Scots needed a late defensive stand to withstand a turnover and hold on for the win.
Pittenger's four touchdowns give him 29 for his career. He is now third all-time in Maryville College history. The record is 33 held by Travis Felder (2010-2013).
Deshjion Whitlock rushed for 81 yards for the Scots. Michael Smith caught seven passes for 97 yards.
Gabe Johnson and Jonathan Clark paced the Scots' defense, which held Averett to 4-of-14 on third-down conversions. The pair combined for 14 tackles with Clark recording three tackles for a loss.
The Scots will play LaGrange College at 1:30 p.m. Saturday at Honaker Field in Maryville.
